disclaimerData.disclaimer:
PATIENT AGREEMENT: This form provides information about the advantages and risks of permanent makeup removal using laser technology (Q-switched, Pico, or Nd:YAG lasers). Read thoroughly and discuss with your practitioner before proceeding.

Take time to consider all options, seek second opinions, and ask questions. The laser targets pigment particles in eyebrows, lips, eyeliner, or other areas, shattering them into fragments cleared by the immune system via lymphatics. Topical numbing and cooling used; sessions last 10-40 minutes with 1-10+ treatments spaced 6-8 weeks apart. Complete removal not always guaranteed; depends on pigment type/color, depth, skin tone, age.

Gradual fading over weeks-months; avoid sun 4 weeks pre/post (SPF 50+), no makeup/picking scabs. Informed of practitioner/location per session; withdraw consent anytime.

RISKS AND POSSIBLE REACTIONS: Common: discomfort (hot snap sensation), redness, swelling, blistering, crusting, scabbing, itching (resolves 1-2 weeks). Less common: infection, allergic reactions to ink fragments, hyper/hypopigmentation (higher darker skin risk), pigment darkening (iron oxide).

Rare: scarring, textural changes, hair loss (eyebrows rare with modern Pico lasers), eye irritation (eyeliner). Contraindications: active infections, recent Accutane (6 months), photosensitizers, pregnancy, keloid tendency.

I confirm understanding of procedure reasons, risks (of doing/not), personal health risks, benefits, alternatives (saline), uncertainties, follow-up care.

MEDICAL IMAGERY: I authorize clinical photos/videos for confidential records.

I certify reading/understanding this form, questions answered satisfactorily, and consent to procedure.

questions.content: Do you comprehend the details that have been given to you?
Do you believe enough information has been shared to allow you to give informed consent?
Have you given your consent voluntarily?
Are there any health issues you currently have?
Are you currently pregnant or nursing a child?
Do you suffer from a neuromuscular disorder (such as Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Do you have an autoimmune condition?
Do you experience any skin problems?
Do you have any known allergies or a history of severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis)?
Is there an active infection at the area where the procedure is planned?
Are you currently on any antibiotics or other prescribed medications?
Is there any other Medical or Social History we should be aware of? If yes, please explain in detail.
What are your goals and desired results for undergoing this procedure? Please elaborate.
Have you undergone this or a comparable treatment previously? If so, were there any issues? Please provide details.
Do you have any concerns? If so, please describe them.
Is there anything else we need to know? Please provide full information.
I will keep this information for the duration of my treatment and consult it as needed.
